articles.title: Activists fear rising surveillance from Asia’s Digital Silk Road - BusinessWorld Online
articles.description: PHNOM PENH — The drones were hard to avoid: they buzzed low over the crowd of protesters holding banners and shouting slogans outside the NagaWorld casino in the Cambodian city of Phnom Penh, then hovered above each of the speakers as they called for justice.

articles.title: Singer Charlie Puth to promote Singapore locations in new destination video - Channel NewsAsia
articles.description: The American singer-songwriter and producer visited several Singapore destinations during his week-long trip, as part of his collaboration with Singapore Tourism Board, highlights of which will be featured in a video to be released in October.

articles.title: Putin calls for de-escalation as Kyrgyz-Tajik border conflict death toll nears 100 - CNN
articles.description: Kyrgyzstan and Tajikistan said on Sunday nearly 100 people had died in their border conflict, as a fragile ceasefire between the Central Asian nations extended into a second day and their mutual ally Russia urged a de-escalation.

articles.title: Aviation industry is recovering, but manpower is a problem: IATA's Philip Goh - CNA
articles.description: Recovery of the industry is on track, although Asia Pacific is lagging compared to other major regions.

SINGAPORE: In the past two years during the pandemic, many people have left the aviation industry - some laid off, some by their own volition - and they may not return.

articles.title: How to rent artwork and paintings monthly in Singapore - Channel NewsAsia
articles.description: Low Sok Leng grew up in a four-room HDB in Hougang that was filled with her dad’s paintings. Now, she has made it her mission to enable every Singaporean to have art at home, through her gallery ARTualize.
articles.content: But Lows radical life change was never driven by money. It was propelled by the love of a daughter for her late artist father, who had entrusted her with a legacy of a thousand paintings. A rare love… [+726 chars]

articles.title: Street-style photographer: Leong Su Shan - Channel NewsAsia
articles.description: Leong Su Shan could very well be Singapore’s first international street portrait photographer – and her snaps have graced magazines such as Vogue. Meet her in this week’s instalment of Creative Capital.

articles.title: Singapore's 'Benjamin Button'? 50-year-old man is biologically just 27 - AsiaOne
